importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date Kada Scott was last seen at her workplace, marking the beginning of the investigation into her disappearance.
The day after a tip led police to the shallow grave where human remains were discovered.
The day the man, Keon King, was arrested and charged with Scott’s kidnapping and another prior incident involving a domestic kidnapping.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The two-week period from when Kada Scott went missing to when her remains were discovered, during which police investigated and received public tips leading to critical evidence.

keyTakeAways: Human remains of an unidentified female were found in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school in Philadelphia.
The remains are being evaluated by the medical examiner to determine if they belong to Kada Scott, a 23-year-old woman who disappeared on October 4, 2025.
Keon King, a 21-year-old man, was arrested and charged with Scott’s kidnapping, as well as a prior kidnapping involving a domestic assault case from earlier in the year.
Tracking phone communications led investigators to King, who was the last person believed to have contact with Scott before she went offline.
A public tip led authorities to a gold 1999 Toyota Camry, believed to be linked to King, which was found in a parking lot.
The police are investigating whether King and Scott had a prior relationship, and whether the case is part of a broader pattern of kidnapping behavior.
The FBI’s Violent Crime Task Force is assisting in the investigation, and preliminary hearings are expected for King in both cases.
The case has prompted public appeals for information, with investigators emphasizing that even small details could be crucial to solving the disappearance.

namedEntities.name: Kada Scott
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 23-year-old woman from Philadelphia who went missing on October 4, 2025, and whose human remains were later found in a shallow grave.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Kada Scott is the central figure in a major missing persons case that has drawn national attention due to the discovery of her remains and ongoing investigation into her disappearance.

namedEntities.name: Keon King
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 21-year-old suspect arrested and charged with the kidnapping of Kada Scott and a prior domestic kidnapping case.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: King is the primary suspect in Scott’s disappearance and has a prior criminal record involving a similar domestic kidnapping case, suggesting a possible pattern of behavior.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia Police Department
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The local law enforcement agency leading the investigation into Kada Scott’s disappearance.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Philadelphia Police Department is central to the investigation, including coordination with the FBI and efforts to track phone communications and locate key evidence.

namedEntities.name: FBI Violent Crime Task Force
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A federal law enforcement unit providing support to Philadelphia police in the investigation.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The FBI’s involvement adds national-level resources and expertise to the case, indicating its severity and the possibility of a broader criminal pattern.

namedEntities.name: John Stanford
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Philadelphia Police First Deputy Commissioner who spoke at a news conference about the discovery of the remains.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Stanford provided official updates on the discovery of the remains and the ongoing efforts to determine their connection to Kada Scott.

namedEntities.name: Ashley Toczylowski
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Assistant District Attorney who discussed the tracking of phone communications and King’s last known contact with Scott.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Toczylowski played a key role in explaining the investigative process and the link between King and Scott through digital evidence.

namedEntities.name: Frank Vanore
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Philadelphia Police Deputy Commissioner who described the relationship between King and Scott and the pattern of behavior.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Vanore emphasized the potential pattern of criminal behavior and the focus on King as the central suspect.

namedEntities.name: Cherelle Parker
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Philadelphia Mayor who issued a statement supporting Kada Scott’s family.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Parker’s public statement reflects the city’s response to the tragedy and underscores the emotional and community impact of the case.

namedEntities.name: Kim Matthews
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Mother of Kada Scott, who expressed fear for her daughter’s safety.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Kim Matthews’s personal statements highlight the family’s emotional distress and the public’s hope for justice and closure.

namedEntities.name: Kevin Scott
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Father of Kada Scott, who urged the public to come forward with information.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Kevin Scott’s statements reinforce the family’s plea for public assistance in solving the case.

namedEntities.name: Gold 1999 Toyota Camry
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A vehicle believed to be linked to Keon King and possibly used in the disappearance of Kada Scott.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The vehicle is a key piece of physical evidence and was located based on a public tip, indicating the role of public input in solving the case.

namedEntities.name: Abandoned school
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A location behind which a shallow grave containing human remains was discovered.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The abandoned school site is the physical location where critical evidence was found, anchoring the case geographically and operationally.

namedEntities.name: Medical Examiner’s Office
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The agency responsible for determining whether the remains belong to Kada Scott.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The medical examiner’s office is central to establishing a forensic link between the remains and Kada Scott.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Two weeks after 23-year-old Philadelphia woman Kada Scott went missing on October 4, 2025, human remains of an unidentified female were discovered in a shallow grave behind an abandoned school. The remains are currently being evaluated by the medical examiner to determine if they belong to Scott. Police have linked her disappearance to Keon King, a 21-year-old man arrested and charged with both Scott’s kidnapping and a prior domestic kidnapping case involving assault. Tracking phone communications led investigators to King, who was the last person known to have contact with Scott before she went offline. A public tip led authorities to a gold 1999 Toyota Camry, believed to be connected to King and possibly used in the abduction. The investigation, led by the Philadelphia Police Department with FBI support, is focused on identifying a pattern of criminal behavior. The case has prompted widespread public appeals for information, with family members and officials emphasizing the urgency and emotional toll of the situation.
title: Police Investigating Disappearance of Philadelphia Woman Say Tip Led Them to Shallow Grave with Human Remains
